perturbation.original_text: Stryker shall have [**] (“Acceptance Notification Period”) following the date the Deliverable is received by Stryker to Accept or reject the Deliverable as described in Section 3.4.
perturbation.changed_text: Stryker shall have 5 days (“Acceptance Notification Period”) following the date the Deliverable is received by Stryker to Accept or reject the Deliverable as described in Section 3.4.
perturbation.explanation: The original contract allows an unspecified period for Stryker to accept or reject deliverables. By setting this period to 5 days, it contradicts standard business practices and could be considered an unreasonably short timeframe, potentially conflicting with fair dealing laws, especially if Deliverables are complex. Most contracts allow for a 'reasonable' time.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing

perturbation.original_text: Conformis shall have [**] (or such longer period of time as may be agreed between the parties in good faith should the scope and complexity of the applicable Deliverable warrant some longer period of time) (“Redelivery Period”) following the date it receives the Failure Notice to correct and redeliver the Deliverable.
perturbation.changed_text: Conformis shall have 2 days (or such longer period of time as may be agreed between the parties in good faith should the scope and complexity of the applicable Deliverable warrant some longer period of time) (“Redelivery Period”) following the date it receives the Failure Notice to correct and redeliver the Deliverable.
perturbation.explanation: The original contract allows an unspecified period for Conformis to correct and redeliver the Deliverable. By setting this period to 2 days, it contradicts standard business practices and could be considered an unreasonably short timeframe, potentially conflicting with fair dealing laws, especially if Deliverables are complex. Most contracts allow for a 'reasonable' time.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing

perturbation.original_text: If such alleged material breach is not remedied in the time period set forth above, the Party alleging material breach shall refer the matter to the chief executive officers of each Party, who shall meet and confer within [**] after notice from the non-breaching Party of its desire for such a meeting.
perturbation.changed_text: If such alleged material breach is not remedied in the time period set forth above, the Party alleging material breach shall refer the matter to the chief executive officers of each Party, who shall meet and confer within 1 day after notice from the non-breaching Party of its desire for such a meeting.
perturbation.explanation: The original contract allows an unspecified period for the chief executive officers of each Party to meet and confer about an alleged material breach. By setting this period to 1 day, it contradicts standard business practices and is not enough time for the chief executive officers to meet, potentially conflicting with fair dealing laws. Most contracts allow for a 'reasonable' time.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing
